Course Provider : Torrens University Australia Campuses :NSW QLD VIC Naturopaths use natural and non-invasive treatments that work in harmony with the body's natural healing mechanisms. They use a range of treatment methods, including: The day-to-day responsibilities of a naturopath typically include: There's one main naturopathic qualification in Australia—a Bachelor of Health Science (Naturopathy), which is a four year naturopathy degree. Course duration: 4 year full time (24 hours per week), or 8 years part time (12 hours per week) Study mode: Mixture of on campus learning, and online learning Years of experience: 7.3% entry level, 36.3% early career, 21% mid career, 26.6 experience, and 8.9% late career Entry requirements: Year 12 or equivalent Units
